relationships.notes: Sadducees challenge Jesus with a resurrection riddle to discredit belief in life after death, prompting Jesus to correct their understanding of Scripture and God’s power.
Matthew groups Sadducees with Pharisees who come to John’s baptism and receive his denunciation, signaling priestly suspicion toward the preparatory movement.
Sadducean priests and the captain of the temple seize Peter and John for proclaiming resurrection in Jesus, jailing them and bringing them before the council.
Paul exploits the Sadducees’ denial of resurrection, angels, and spirits when he appears before the council, exposing their doctrinal conflict with Pharisees.
The high priest and his Sadducean associates lead the council in opposing the apostles, demonstrating their institutional power.
As part of the chief priestly leadership, Sadducees participate in delivering Jesus to Pilate for Roman sentencing, aligning temple authority with imperial power.

traits.identity_and_beliefs: Presented as a Jewish group associated with priestly and aristocratic circles, characterized by denial of the resurrection and skepticism about angels and spirits.
traits.conflict_with_jesus: Approach Jesus with a question about levirate marriage in the resurrection, intending to show the doctrine’s absurdity; Jesus rebukes their ignorance of Scripture and the power of God.
traits.role_in_passion: Appear among the chief priests and leaders involved in plots against Jesus and in his trial before the council.
traits.contrast_with_pharisees: In the Gospels, often paired with Pharisees yet distinguished by their different stance on resurrection and the supernatural.

traits.opposition_to_apostles: Some Sadducees, particularly those associated with the high priestly family, are annoyed at the apostles’ proclamation of resurrection and have them arrested.
traits.participation_in_council: Represent the faction in the council most resistant to the message of resurrection, contributing to the early persecution of the church.
traits.pharisee_sadducee_divide: Paul exploits the division between Pharisees and Sadducees over resurrection, angels, and spirits to create dissension in the council.
traits.narrative_role: Act as chief opponents of the resurrection message in Acts, illustrating intra-Jewish theological conflicts that shape responses to the gospel.
